title: Teamwork Ribbons (Yes, I know the amount doesn't matter.)
body:
So.. I understand that the amount does not matter as much as the frequency and not getting reported or whatnot.... Here is my dilemma:
I have not been notified of being reported...that I know of.
I have over 800 teamworks.
I have over 300 honorable opponents..
I get something every game on average..
I have less than 800 hours in the game total..

800 teamworks, 40 mins per game, 740 (or so) hours in the game.. sounds pretty consistent not too mention my 100+ friendlys and 300+ honorable opponents.. I don't want it to be fixed... I am jus lookin for a better understanding of how to get the ribbons then the frequency or amount or randomness. Thank you! :) 

P.S. I have not ever posted in any kind of comment board, so I hope I did this correctly!! :))

replies.body:
Unfortunately, I cannot give you as straightforward of an answer as you would want.  There is a formula that determines when you earn or lose ribbons that takes in account how many games played vs how often/consistently you are honored.  If you are under this threshold, then you will either not earn a ribbon or be in in risk of losing it.

While I cannot give you a hard and fast rule, continue being an upstanding Summoner!  The more you play and get honored, the higher chance you will have of getting one! :)
Crests should be a permanent thing unless you get suspended.

I'm pretty sure the algorithm is based on the average among all players, and players below level 30 have a MUCH higher chance if giving an honor at the end of the game. I remember when I was leveling my account I was rotating through banners all over the place for different things, but then the instant I hit 30 the honors stopped and the banners soon went away. I suppose I could have immediately stopped being worthy of honors but it felt more like players at 30 just didn't care about giving honors no matter how well you behaved.

You actually need a combination of honors to get the ribbons (except for Honorable opponent, you only need that honor for that ribbon). You can have 4 Teamwork honors every match, but you'll never get a ribbon without honors for another one.

Dude honestly don't even worry about the damn ribbons.  Focus on yourself and your gameplay, and game knowledge.  I have a ridiculous ammount ribbons, and for a time was getting honored in varous ones often, and finally got a ribbon.  Then I guess I got reported for something, never was punished, but just getting reported will take it away.

After that I stopped giving a damn about it.
